title: 2 July Rebels members injured in attack in Uttara
body: Two members of the organisation, July Rebels, were seriously injured after they were attacked with sharp weapons by a group of assailants in Dhaka's Uttara this evening. Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Uttara East Police Station, Morshed Alam, confirmed the incident. "The attack happened at the July Rebels office at Uttara Sector 8," he told The Daily Star. A member of July Rebels, speaking on condition of anonymity, said, "The victims were returning to their office after taking part in a human chain. The protest was held against the shooting of Inqilab Moncho spokesperson Osman Hadi outside the BNS Centre in Uttara." He said, "A group of 10 to 15 people suddenly entered the July Rebels office and attacked the two members with sharp weapons. The attackers were carrying firearms, but they did not use them." Yasin and Rezwan were rescued following the attack and taken to Kuwait-Bangladesh Maitree Hospital and USB Specialised Hospital in Uttara for treatment. Police said they are investigating the incident and trying to identify those involved.
